007package renderer.scene;
008
009import renderer.framebuffer.FrameBuffer;
010
011import java.io.FileInputStream;
012import java.io.BufferedInputStream;
013import java.io.File;
014import java.io.FileNotFoundException;
015import java.io.IOException;
016import javax.imageio.ImageIO;
017import java.awt.image.BufferedImage;
018import java.awt.Color;
019
020/**
021   This represents a texture with transparency (RGBA).
022*/
023public class Texture
024{
025   public int width;
026   public int height;
027   public int[] pixel_buffer; // contains each pixel's color data
028   public int[] alpha_buffer; // contains each pixel's transparency data
029   public final String name;  // used for debugging
030
031
032   /**
033      Create an empty {@code Texture} with the given size and name.
034
035      @param name    {@link String} name for this {@code Texture}
036      @param width   width of this {@code Texture}
037      @param height  height of this {@code Texture}
038   */
039   public Texture(final int width, final int height, final String name)
040   {
041      this.name = name;
042      this.width = width;
043      this.height = height;
044      // Create the pixel buffers.
045      this.pixel_buffer = new int[width * height];
046      this.alpha_buffer = new int[width * height];
047   }
048
049
050   /**
051      Create a {@code Texture} directly from RGBA pixel data.
052      <p>
053      The {@code data} array is assumed to contain
054      {@code 4 * width * height} ints where every
055      four ints represent the RGBA color and transparency
056      values for a pixel of the texture.
057
058      @param name    {@link String} name for this {@code Texture}
059      @param width   width of this {@code Texture}
060      @param height  height of this {@code Texture}
061      @param data    array holding the RGBA color values for each pixel of this {@code Texture}
062   */
063   public Texture(final String name, final int width, final int height, final int[] data)
064   {
065      this.name = name;
066      this.width = width;
067      this.height = height;
068      this.pixel_buffer = new int[width * height];
069      this.alpha_buffer = new int[width * height];
070
071      for (int i = 0; i < height; ++i)
072      {
073         for (int j = 0; j < width; ++j)
074         {
075            final int r = data[4*(i*width + j) + 0];
076            final int g = data[4*(i*width + j) + 1];
077            final int b = data[4*(i*width + j) + 2];
078            final int a = data[4*(i*width + j) + 3];
079            pixel_buffer[(height - 1 - i)*width + j] = (new Color(r, g, b)).getRGB();
080            alpha_buffer[(height - 1 - i)*width + j] = a;  // alpha
081         }
082      }
083   }
084
085
086   /**
087      Create a {@code Texture} from pixel data in a PPM file.
088
089      @param inputFileName  must name a PPM image file with magic number P6.
090   */
091   public Texture(String filename) // name of the ppm file to load texture data from
092   {
093      this.name = filename;
094
095      // Read the pixel data in a PPM file.
096      // http://stackoverflow.com/questions/2693631/read-ppm-file-and-store-it-in-an-array-coded-with-c
097      BufferedInputStream bis = null;
098      try
099      {
100         final FileInputStream fis = new FileInputStream(filename);
101         bis = new BufferedInputStream(fis);
102      }
103      catch (FileNotFoundException e)
104      {
105         e.printStackTrace(System.err);
106         System.err.printf("ERROR! Could not open texture %s\n", filename);
107         System.exit(-1);
108      }
109
110      try
111      {
112         // Read image format string "P6".
113         String magicNumber = "";
114         char c = (char)bis.read();
115         while (c != '\n')
116         {
117            magicNumber += c;
118            c = (char)bis.read();
119         }
120         if (! magicNumber.trim().startsWith("P6"))
121         {
122            System.err.printf("ERROR! Improper PPM number in file %s\n", filename);
123            System.exit(-1);
124         }
125
126         c = (char)bis.read();
127         if ( '#' == c ) // read (and discard) IrfanView comment
128         {
129            while (c != '\n')
130            {
131               c = (char)bis.read();
132            }
133            c = (char)bis.read();
134         }
135
136         // Read image dimensions.
137         String widthDim = "";
138         while (c != ' ' && c != '\n')
139         {
140            widthDim += c;
141            c = (char)bis.read();
142         }
143         width = Integer.parseInt(widthDim.trim());
144
145         String heightDim = "";
146         c = (char)bis.read();
147         while (c != '\n')
148         {
149            heightDim += c;
150            c = (char)bis.read();
151         }
152         height = Integer.parseInt(heightDim.trim());
153
154         //System.err.printf("Texture %s: width=%d, height=%d\n\n",filename,width,height);
155
156         // Read image rgb dimensions (which we don't use).
157         c = (char)bis.read();
158         while (c != '\n')
159         {
160            c = (char)bis.read();
161         }
162
163         // Create the pixel buffers.
164         pixel_buffer = new int[this.width * this.height];
165         alpha_buffer = new int[this.width * this.height];
166
167         // Create a pixel data array.
168         final byte[] pixelData = new byte[3];
169
170         // Read pixel data, one pixel at a time, from the PPM file.
171         for (int y = height - 1; y >= 0; y--)
172         {
173            for (int x = 0; x < width; x++)
174            {
175               if ( bis.read(pixelData, 0, 3) != 3 )
176               {
177                  System.err.printf("ERROR! Could not load %s\n", filename);
178                  System.exit(-1);
179               }
180               int r = pixelData[0];
181               int g = pixelData[1];
182               int b = pixelData[2];
183               if (r < 0) r = 256+r; // NOTE: Java doesn't have an unsigned
184               if (g < 0) g = 256+g; // byte data type so we need to convert
185               if (b < 0) b = 256+b; // negative bytes into postive ints.
186               pixel_buffer[(y * width) + x] = (new Color(r, g, b)).getRGB();
187               alpha_buffer[(y * width) + x] = 255;  // opaque
188            }
189         }
190         bis.close();
191      }
192      catch (IOException e)
193      {
194         e.printStackTrace(System.err);
195         System.err.printf("ERROR! Could not read texture %s\n", filename);
196         System.exit(-1);
197      }
198   }
199
200
201   /**
202      Create a {@code Texture} from a {@link FrameBuffer}'s {@link FrameBuffer.Viewport}
203
204      @param vp  {@link FrameBuffer.Viewport} whose pixel data will become a {@code Texture}
205   */
206   public Texture(final FrameBuffer.Viewport vp)
207   {
208      this.name = "from Viewport";
209      this.width  = vp.getWidthVP();
210      this.height = vp.getHeightVP();
211      // Create the pixel buffers.
212      this.pixel_buffer = new int[this.width * this.height];
213      this.alpha_buffer = new int[this.width * this.height];
214
215      for (int i = 0; i < height; ++i)
216      {
217         for (int j = 0; j < width; ++j)
218         {
219            pixel_buffer[(height - 1 - i)*width + j] = vp.getPixelVP(j,i).getRGB();
220            alpha_buffer[(height - 1 - i)*width + j] = 255;  // opaque
221         }
222      }
223   }
224
225
226   /**
227      Read the {@code Texture} data from a file
228      using Java's {@link ImageIO} library.
229
230      @param filename  name of a PNG, JPG, or GIF image file
231   */
232   private static Texture makeTextureNotPPM(final String filename)
233   {
234      BufferedImage img = null;
235
236      try
237      {
238         img = ImageIO.read(new File(filename));
239      }
240      catch(IOException e)
241      {
242         e.printStackTrace(System.err);
243         System.err.println("Cannot read image file.");
244         System.exit(-1);
245      }
246
247      final int width  = img.getWidth();
248      final int height = img.getHeight();
249
250      final Texture texture = new Texture(width, height, filename);
251
252      for (int i = 0; i < height; ++i)
253      {
254         for (int j = 0; j < width; ++j)
255         {
256            texture.pixel_buffer[(height - 1 - i)*width + j] = img.getRGB(j,i);
257            texture.alpha_buffer[(height - 1 - i)*width + j] = 255;  // opaque
258         }
259      }
260
261      System.err.printf("Texture %s: width=%d, height=%d\n\n",filename,width,height);
262
263      return texture;
264   }
265
266
267   /**
268      For debugging.
269
270      @return {@link String} representation of this {@code Texture} object
271   */
272   @Override
273   public String toString()
274   {
275      String result = "Texture: (width="+width+", height="+height+")";
276      result += " name = " + "\"" + name + "\"";
277      return result;
278   }
279}
